title: 90. You Look Good - Lady Antebellum
text: Hey bartender can you call me a 747 . . . by DinaLe* Love Lady A and the pop-country genre . . . But, this doesn't seem to have that certain something that is undoubtedly Lady A. Catchy, but not worth buying if you like listening to a Lady A playlist. This is like throwing a Reba song into a Tim McGraw playlist - doesn't work! Biography Formed: 2006 in Augusta, GA Genre: Country Years Active: '00s, '10s Lady Antebellum blend contemporary country with soulful '60s R&B into an infectious brew that relies on the trio's rich harmonies and impeccable instrumental skills. The trio was formed in 2006 by Charles Kelley (brother of singer/songwriter Josh Kelley), Hillary Scott (daughter of Grammy-winning country artist Linda Davis), and Dave Haywood, and soon graduated from dive bars to the Grand Ole Opry. Their 2009 single "Need You Now" became the first of many hits to reach not just the country Top Ten... Top Albums and Songs by Lady Antebellum 1.
